text: I had a bullying boss and as a result I
was humiliated
I felt exploited I felt undervalued and
underrated I felt powerless everyone has
heard of the school bully the kid who
terrorizes students in the halls and on
the playground but just like the rest of
us bullies grow up and they get jobs the
boss targeted me I think because he was
threatened by my confidence a recent
post on the New York Times well blog
generated more than three hundred
stories of workplace aggression for many
the bullying was so severe that victims
became depressed and quit their jobs
bullying in the workplace is repeated
health harming verbal abuse
psychological abuse work interference
work sabotage I was prevented from
having a telephone here I was the
producer of a television show and I did
not have a telephone that I could use to
do my job I had to use a payphone in the
hallway outside my office surveys show
that as many as one out of three workers
may be victims of bullying in the
workplace
i Rowling belittling comments and
excluding workers from essential
meetings or job functions are common
tactics you know you're doing a great
job and the fact that you're doing a
great job is the reason that you're
being harassed I mean it's kind of
surreal 37% of Americans have
experienced bullying in the workplace
and that represents 54 million people
about 40% of the time the workplace
bully is a woman and she usually picks
on other women just like the boss in The
Devil Wears Prada a character said to be
based on a real person take a chance
hire the smart fat girl we were very
dedicated to our jobs we didn't want to
just give up and walk away we wanted to
save our jobs in most cases the only way
that you can survive it is to leave the
job one of the reasons I left was I did
not want to endanger my health anymore I
couldn't sleep I felt nauseous my
stomach was in an odd
I had to put one foot in front of the
other to walk into the workplace the
bullying has been going on forever but
there are a lot of things that have
taken place historically that we've
lived with and the point comes in time
where the time has come where we
actually need legislation to make the
world a better place
legal experts say current laws aren't
enough to protect workers from bullying
on the job we think we're at the same
place where the civil rights laws were
right before they were passed we feel
we're exactly where sexual harassment
law was right before that came into
being a law and efforts are underway in
several states for additional
legislation to address the issue I'm
Tara Parker Pope for The New York Times
nothing can compensate for what I lost I
lost years and years you don't get those
back in a lawsuit
